content.webTitle: Big three on their way out of Valley Parade

fields.headline: Big three on their way out of Valley Parade
fields.bodyText: Benito Carbone When he signed in August, then manager Chris Hutchings said: "I think he's a 20-goal striker, a fantastic player who can score unbelievable goals." But he has scored only three league goals since then and has not played since being substituted on Boxing Day. Stan Collymore In a career full of short stays Bradford, at three months, look set to become the shortest yet. After a brilliant debut goal against local rivals Leeds, life has gone swiftly downhill and he is unlikely to play for the club again. Dan Petrescu "He will prove a great acquisition," said Bradford's chairman Geoffrey Richmond of his £1m close-season signing from Chelsea, where he was a popular, versatile and free-scoring midfielder. He has been none of those at Bradford, and he last played a full game in November.
